disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 25 February to end of Friday 25 February GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A 'clean' Atlantic breeze should give good dispersion of local emissions for most of Friday. However, winds are forecast to fall light from late afternoon and this will result in some build-up of nitrogen dioxide and particulates by busy roads during the evening rush hour period. <br/><br/>Air pollution is though expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 26 February to end of Saturday 26 February GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Saturday is forecast to be around 10 degrees, dry with sunny intervals and a moderate southerly breeze.<br/><br/>Back trajectories show air arriving at the south-east having taken a brief path up from northern France. The wind speed, lower weekend emissions and relatively short path should mean any import is unlikely to reach the moderate threshold for the day. <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>
